conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source, objects, and shadows is necessary to determine shadow changes.
Initial positions of shadows A, B, C, D extend towards the left side.
The size of each shadow is determined by the angle of the light relative to the object and the distance from the light source to the object.
When the light source moves to the right, shadows will shift and elongate due to the new lighting angle.
Shadow A will shift to extend more towards the object itself and possibly even to the right.
Shadow B will shift from its current leftward extension to an extension more towards the object or slightly to the right.
Shadow C will start extending more towards the object itself or slightly to the right.
Shadow D will shift from extending to the left to extending more towards the object or slightly to the right.
Shadows will become longer because the angle of the light relative to the objects will increase.
The exact amount of elongation depends on the distance the light source moves and its new height relative to the objects.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift from extending predominantly to the left to extending more towards the objects themselves or slightly to the right, and all shadows will become longer.
